FacilityName: City of Washington Wastewater Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
City of Washington
Washington, NC

WWTP Chlorine Executive Summary

The City of Washington continues to implement a comprehensive program to safely manage chlorine at its Wastewater Treatment Plant. Chlorine is used in the disinfection process of treating wastewater before the water is discharged into the Tar-Pamilco River Basin. The plant is located 1399 West 2nd in the City of Washington. There have been no chlorine incidents or accidents in the most recent Five-Year history period.

The Process Safety Management (PSM) that was completed in 1996 has been maintained current for the past ten years. The PSM compliance also demonstrates our compliance with the Risk Management Program (RMP) Prevention Program. Key activities have included:

o    An annual review of  all chlorine, PSM and RMP procedures
o    Three Year Refreshed training conducted on February 3, 2009
o    A Process Hazards Analysis conducted in April 3, 2008
o    Self Audits every three years with the last one on May 14, 2009
o    A comprehensive Mechanical Integrity program that uses a computer-based maintenance scheduling program
o    An annual review and update of the Emergency Response Plan including periodic drills with the Washington Fire/Rescue Department

In addition to these compliance activities, the City of Washington has implemented these chlorine safety controls

o    The cylinders are stored inside a secure building which provide significant passive mitigation against a release
o    The plant computerized SCADA system monitors the chemical release alarms 24 hours a day
o    Any active mitigation would be applied by the Haz-Mat team and support personnel of the Washington Fire/Rescue Department. 

Within the Utilities department, there are monthly safety meeting to review an OSHA subject or discuss a safety issue. Routine training is conducted for topics such as:

o    Hazard Communications
o    Personal Protective Equipment
o    Lockout/Tagout
o    Site Security
o    Confined Space


As a result of our programs, the plant has had

an excellent safety record. We plan to continue our emphasis on safety to maintain and improve our safety performance.                                    
                                   
Report by:
Stephen Adam Waters II 
Superintendent Water Resources
